personal_info.location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada (splits time between San Francisco and Toronto)

professional_info.industry: Conversational AI / SaaS / Customer Support Automation
achievements: CEO & Cofounder of Voiceflow, building one of the leading AI agent platforms for customer support and automation.
Voiceflow reached 500K+ users and 4,000+ customers, raising $35M+ from investors including Google, Craft Ventures, Felicis, and True Ventures.
Angel investor in numerous early-stage startups and funds (VendorPM, Secoda, MoonPay, StadiumLive, Weekend Fund, Ripple Ventures, Union VC, etc.).
Previously founded Flare Software, building a social networking app with 4K monthly active users at peak.

education_info.degree: Bachelor's degree (incomplete, dropped out to start Voiceflow)
previous_education: Ivey Business School at Western University — Dean's List, Academic Scholarship, Jackson Family Entrepreneurship Scholarship

recent_achievements: Launched Voiceflow’s AI Agent generation tool, now generating ~1K agents per day.
Released new transcript and evaluation features to analyze, debug, and improve AI agents.
Expanded Voiceflow customer base to 4,000+ organizations, including JP Morgan, Home Depot, Amazon, and government agencies.
conversation_starters: Ask about Voiceflow’s growth journey from early conversational design to a full AI agent platform.
Discuss how AI agent generation is changing the customer support industry.
Explore his angel investing thesis and what he looks for in early founders.
Talk about his decision to drop out of Ivey to pursue Voiceflow full-time.
notable_projects: Voiceflow — AI agent building platform for customer support, with 500K+ users and 4,000+ customers.
Angel investments in startups like MoonPay, Secoda, StadiumLive, VendorPM.
NEXT Canada Board Member, supporting entrepreneurship education.
Flare Software — Early startup, built a social networking app with thousands of monthly users.

credibility_indicators: CEO & Cofounder of Voiceflow with significant funding and global adoption
Active angel investor in multiple high-growth startups
Visible thought leader in AI and automation (frequent posts, product launches)
person_analysis.overview: Braden Ream is the CEO and Cofounder of Voiceflow, a leading AI agent platform for customer support automation. Recognized as Forbes 30 under 30, he has scaled Voiceflow to over 500K users and 4,000 customers globally, raising $35M+ from top-tier investors. He is also an active angel investor and board member at NEXT Canada, with a passion for supporting early-stage founders. His career reflects a strong balance of entrepreneurship, product innovation, and ecosystem building.
person_analysis.executive_summary: Braden Ream is a Canadian entrepreneur and Forbes 30 under 30 honoree, best known as CEO & Cofounder of Voiceflow, where he is building the world’s leading AI agent automation platform. With extensive experience in startup building, leadership, and angel investing, Braden has positioned himself as a major voice in AI-driven customer support and early-stage entrepreneurship.
key_insights: Strong entrepreneurial background, building Voiceflow into a top global AI agent platform.
Deeply networked in the startup ecosystem as an angel investor and NEXT Canada board member.
Well-recognized thought leader with a high public presence and strong credibility.
Represents the new wave of AI founders bridging customer needs with cutting-edge automation technology.
